metadata.title: CVE-2023-52510 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:ieee802154: ca8210: Fix a potential UAF in ca8210_probe Ifof_clk_add_provider() fails in ca8210_register_ext_clock(), it callsclk_unregister() to release priv->clk and returns an error. However, thecaller ca8210_probe() then calls ca8210_remove(), where priv->clk is freedagain in ca8210_unregister_ext_clock(). In this case, a use-after-free mayhappen in the second time we call clk_unregister(). Fix this by removingthe first clk_unregister(). Also, priv->clk could be an error code onfailure of clk_register_fixed_rate(). Use IS_ERR_OR_NULL to catch this casein ca8210_unregister_ext_clock().

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52510` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.6.0-14-generic - 6.6.0-14.14
linux-image-unsigned-6.6.0-14-generic - 6.6.0-14.14
linux-image-unsigned-6.6.0-14-generic-64k - 6.6.0-14.14
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.6.0-1001-aws - 6.6.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.6.0-1001-azure - 6.6.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.6.0-1001-gcp - 6.6.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1003-gke - 6.8.0-1003.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1001-ibm - 6.8.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.6.0-14-lowlatency - 6.6.0-14.14.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.6.0-14-lowlatency-64k - 6.6.0-14.14.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.6.0-1001-oracle - 6.6.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-6.7.0-1001-raspi - 6.7.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1003-oem - 6.8.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-intel - 6.8.0-1001.6
No subscription required
